SENT.plain: A 59-year-old man presented with the acute onset of paresthesias and pain in the left neck, face, and forehead
On subsequent investigation he was found to have a subadventitial type of carotid artery dissection, producing an ipsilateral Horner's syndrome with normal carotid angiography
MRI imaging of the neck structures, using fat saturation technique, showed the subadventitial dissection, sparing the vessel lumen
MRI offers a non-invasive method of diagnosis and follow-up for carotid artery dissection
